text: Being on your own would be sad, sick and weird. I don't trust myself. I need that balance.
author: Daniel Craig

text: I was a very good girl for a long time, that's what really drew me to acting. The stage was the perfect place to be outrageous, to be sad, to be angry, to be all these different things.
author: Joan Allen

text: Elaine is just in pain. I think Elaine has become very, very sad woman. She is someone who is in deep need of many hours of analysis and I like to think that I'm not that type of person.
author: Julia Louis-Dreyfus

text: I never get scared making these kinds of movies because it's all make-believe, but I did cry when I saw the finished version of Man On Fire because it is so sad.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: So war is an extremely sad business, because the majority of people don't want to be in it.
author: Gerald Scarfe

text: I've traveled around the country and I read local newspapers and all of that, and it's a sad, sad thing to go from city to city and see the small newspapers and they're tiny. They're tiny not only in size but also in scope.
author: Jim Lehrer

text: If you win all the time, you lose the drama in life. To make the happy moments happy, you need the sad moments too.
author: Doug Davidson

text: It's an indication of how cynical our society has become that any kind of love story with a sad theme is automatically ridiculed as sentimental junk.
author: Winona Ryder

text: If you don't know about pain and trouble, you're in sad shape. They make you appreciate life.
author: Evel Knievel

text: This Olympics is almost a little sad. It is my final Olympics. There are a lot of good memories.
author: Bonnie Blair

text: I've been getting into Nick Drake lately, the folk singer. Sad, gorgeous stuff.
author: Anthony Doerr

text: I can see the humorous side of things and enjoy the fun when it comes but look where I will, there seems to me always more sadness than joy in life.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

text: Apart from the fact that your physical ability starts to decline, I also think someone in their fifties being childlike becomes a little sad. You've got to be careful.
author: Rowan Atkinson

text: I only really watch sport. That's where you see real joy. I don't like watching much else on TV, because it's generally either twisted or sad.
author: Roger Milla

text: The pro athlete is a sad tale. He signs a big contract and thinks he's set for life. I didn't think I was set for life, and I don't now. As athletes, we are important, celebrities, in demand and rich. Then we are out of the game and we are not important, not celebrities, not in demand and not rich.
author: Fran Tarkenton

text: We try to... we are, I suppose to a certain extent all affected and erm, that is both funny and sad I think.
author: Tony Hancock

text: No not really, it is just like real life. Not everyday you are happy and not everyday you are sad.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: My solo album is dead and buried. We had the funeral. It was sad and I cried a lot but it made such a beautiful corpse that we had an open casket.
author: Shirley Manson

text: Even modern English people are imperious, superior, ridden by class. All of the hypocrisy and the difficulties that are endemic in being British also make it an incredibly fertile place culturally. A brilliant place to live. Sad but true.
author: Pete Townshend

text: I don't wanta do any Blues or any sad songs.
author: Bob Livingston

text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: Better by far you should forget and smile than that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina G. Rossetti

text: I had never felt so lonely and so sad in my entire life.
author: Susan Smith

text: When you're happy you don't always have to be laughing, and when you're sad you don't have to be crying sometimes it's the opposite. You laugh when you're the most upset.
author: Freddie Highmore

text: Some really good things kind of swing both ways and I like to see people that can swing really, really, really sad and horrible and terrible and really, really, really beautiful and funny.
author: Beth Henley

text: What's really sad is that a lot of very talented people are being forced to do things that are very embarrassing and I don't intend to be one of them.
author: Boy George

text: Nowadays you really have to pump out that blockbuster in order to have the luxury of getting a body of work, and that's sad because the work suffers. Today everything is based on money. The older actors, they inspire me.
author: Dylan McDermott

text: However, we might oppose it, abortion is a sad feature of modern life.
author: Robert Casey

text: You can't have an up without a down, a right without a left, a back without a front - or a happy without a sad.
author: Harlan Coben

text: One should either be sad or joyful. Contentment is a warm sty for eaters and sleepers.
author: Eugene O'Neill

text: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Next to a lost battle, nothing is so sad as a battle that has been won.
author: Arthur Wellesley

text: You know, why at the end of your life should you assemble thousands of pages of 'Why am I so sad, why am I so depressed?' Instead, assemble thousands of pages of why you're so content.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: Better by far you should forget and smile that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina Rossetti

text: I'm sad to see the passing of the great drug warriors. I certainly did my part in that battle and I don't regret any of it.
author: Marc Maron

text: It's sad that the most glorious of sexual experiences can make us feel guilty, ashamed, embarrassed, and abnormal.
author: Sue Johanson

text: It's a sad day when a cartoon is doing more and cares more and pays more attention to the environment than our president.
author: Kathy Najimy

text: It's really sad for me that in the United States the Latino community is losing its culture and language, especially among kids born here - a lot of them can't even speak our language.
author: Romeo Santos

text: It was sad when Sid Vicious died... I was freaked out when Phil Lynott died from Thin Lizzy. I cried. It was too crazy.
author: Dee Dee Ramone

text: I've had moments where I realize my body isn't going to withstand many more seasons, but I am very satisfied with my career and I am trying not to look at retirement as a sad thing.
author: Cat Osterman

text: The sad part about our past is that religions, ironically enough, are responsible for creating the most destructive idea that has ever been visited upon the human race: the idea that there is such a thing as 'better.'
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: I think I would be very sad if I wasn't able to have a baby.
author: Nicole Kidman

text: One of the sad things about contemporary journalism is that it actually matters very little. The world now is almost inured to the power of journalism. The best journalism would manage to outrage people. And people are less and less inclined to outrage.
author: David Simon

text: I am not a sad clown. I am not a sad clown.
author: Nathan Lane

text: It would be sad if my best work had been 20 years ago and now I only had memories.
author: Demian Bichir

text: Now I'll read anytime, anywhere. I love reading in front of the space heater. Isn't that a sad confession? But it's like my substitute for the roaring fireplace of yore.
author: Karen Russell

text: How sad it is that we give up on people who are just like us.
author: Fred Rogers

text: You have to keep hobbies in L.A. Otherwise, it's sad.
author: Lake Bell

text: The president we have today is a typical Washington politician that's prone to hyperbole and decisiveness and false outrage. And I think it's very sad - very sad to watch.
author: Marco Rubio

text: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
author: Franz Schubert

text: It was a long time in the making, my divorce. One day became less special than the next, and pretty soon, we ceased all conversation. It is a sad day when you have nothing left to say.
author: Ricki Lake

text: And in real life endings aren't always neat, whether they're happy endings, or whether they're sad endings.
author: Stephen King

text: Christmas makes everything twice as sad.
author: Doug Coupland

text: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
author: Arthur Koestler

text: I just did an interview where I was asked whether I drink beer or whisky, and I was sad to reveal that I'm pounding spring water.
author: Brad Delson

text: A lot of our entertainment throws into detail the stagnation and illness of how we live today-it's sad and it's sick... and it's profitable.
author: Heather Donahue

text: My parents' divorce left me with a lot of sadness and pain and acting, and especially humour, was my way of dealing with all that.
author: Jennifer Aniston

text: Don't Cry Daddy is a pretty sad song. He got to the end of it and it was just real quiet and Elvis says, I'm gonna cut that someday for my daddy. And, by God, he did. He lived up to his word.
author: Mac Davis

text: And I remember going to the record studio and there was a park across the street and I'd see all the children playing and I would cry because it would make me sad that I would have to work instead.
author: Michael Jackson

text: I know for works for me - those wonderful sad love songs.
author: Toni Braxton

text: What's sad is that there is an addictive quality to that, to believing your own hype to allowing yourself to become validated by others and no longer by yourself. That's the danger of celebrity.
author: Giovanni Ribisi

text: 'Vegas' was something very close to me. I had such a blast doing that. I'm still a little upset that we never really got to shoot that final episode. So many people were invested in it. I'll always be sad about that.
author: Josh Duhamel

text: The flesh, alas, is sad, and I have read all the books.
author: Stephane Mallarme

text: Sad will be the day for any man when he becomes contented with the thoughts he is thinking and the deeds he is doing - where there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger which he knows he was meant and made to do.
author: Phillips Brooks

text: Well the country songs themselves are three-chord stories, ballads which are mostly sad. If you are already feeling sorry for yourself when you listen to them they will take you to an even sadder place.
author: Willie Nelson

text: With my schedule being so crazy, I can't call every day or hang out with my friends like I used to and that's definitely sad.
author: Jordin Sparks

text: I don't know what to say to that, but I have to agree with Johnny that, yeah, we do touch upon things that most men would rather not admit: That we feel pain, we cry, get sad and sometimes don't deal well with disappointment.
author: Peter Steele

text: It always makes me sad when I think of how I saw Wagner wasting his vitality, not only by singing their parts to some of his artists, but acting out the smallest details, and of how few they were who were responsive to his wishes.
author: Anton Seidl

text: My mother and father were very strange people. They tried to be funny which is always very sad to me.
author: Jonathan Winters

text: The attacks on the World Trade Center and the Pentagon shook our nation to the core. Americans were deeply frightened, sad, and angry, and they rallied around a President who, at the time, showed impressive certitude and calm.
author: Eliot Spitzer

text: If I can procure three hundred good substantial names of persons, or bodies, or institutions, I cannot fail to do well for my family, although I must abandon my life to its success, and undergo many sad perplexities and perhaps never see again my own beloved America.
author: John James Audubon
